William Phelps }}</ref> Her family was on vacation in Mexico at the time of the attack.<ref name="ColdCaseFiles" /><ref name="OCRegister2009" /> A [[pipe wrench]], reported missing by Cruz's stepfather, was thought to be the murder weapon.<ref name="sudden terror" />{{rp|458}}
The southern California murders were not initially thought to be connected by investigators in their respective jurisdictions. A Sacramento detective strongly believed that the East Area Rapist was responsible for the Goleta attacks, but the Santa Barbara County Sheriff's Department attributed them to a local career criminal who was later murdered. Investigating the crimes not committed in Goleta caused local police to follow false leads related to men who were close to the female victims. One person, later cleared, was charged with two murders. The cases were linked almost entirely by DNA testing, many years later.<ref name="sudden terror" />
== Suspect profile ==
=== Known physical characteristics ===
These physical characteristics are considered factual based on crime-scene evidence and nearly-universal agreement by victims and law enforcement: * [[White people|White]] male * About {{cvt|5|ft|10|in|m}} tall * Slender, athletic build * [[Shoe size#United States and Canada|Size 9]] to {{frac|9|1|2}} shoe * [[ABO blood group system|Type A]] blood * [[Forensic serology|Non-secretor]]: Sperm does not contain blood-group antigens.<ref name="PsychologicalProfile">{{cite web |title = Criminal Investigative Analysis |url = http://www.aetv.com/cold_case_files/web_exclusives/ep46/nightstalkerprofile.pdf |publisher = A&E |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20121007011328/http://www.aetv.com/cold_case_files/web_exclusives/ep46/nightstalkerprofile.pdf |archivedate = October 7, 2012 |format = PDF }}</ref> * Physically agile and capable of sprinting, bicycling, and scaling fences
=== {{anchor|Probable physical characteristics}}Probable characteristics ===
These physical characteristics are considered probable; a small percentage of victims described the perpetrator differently: * 18–25 years old when the rapes began in 1976; authorities believe him to be between 60 and 75 years old in 2018.<ref name="crime q&a" /> * Blond or brown hair * Blue or light-colored eyes * Penis size "small" or "smaller than average"
According to the Sacramento County Sheriff's Department, microscopic paint chips were found at three crime scenes (two homicides and a rape).<ref name="Locke2013">{{cite news |url = http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/article2578864.html |title = Investigators explore new leads in effort to identify East Area Rapist |last1 = Locke |first1 = Cathy |date = September 21, 2013 |work = The Sacramento Bee |access-date = October 30, 2017 |archive-url = https://archive.today/20171031003045/http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/article2578864.html |archive-date = October 31, 2017 |dead-url = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> This suggests that the Golden State Killer may have worked in construction, possibly using a paint spray gun.<ref>{{cite news |last1 = Locke |first1 = Cathy |title = Could paint linked to East Area Rapist be traced to companies that sold or used it? |url = http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article199464804.html |access-date = February 10, 2018 |work = The Sacramento Bee |date = February 9, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180210074518/http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article199464804.html |archivedate = February 10, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Construction work had been ongoing near the 1979 Goleta murder scene, and a cold-case investigator contacted the developer in 2013 to identify subcontractors working at the site and obtain employment records.<ref name="Locke2013" />
=== {{anchor|Potential psychological profile}}Psychological profile ===
After criminologists matched [[serological]] evidence found at the southern California murder scenes, a speculative psychological profile of the Golden State Killer was compiled based on a probabilistic analysis. According to Leslie D'Ambrosia, primary author of the profile, the Golden State Killer probably had the following characteristics:<ref name="PsychologicalProfile" /> * An emotional age equivalent to a 26- to 30-year-old at the time the murders began in 1979 * Engaged in [[Paraphilia|paraphilic]] behavior and brutal sex in his personal life * Engaged in sex with prostitutes * Had some knowledge of police investigative methods and evidence-gathering techniques * Sexually functional, capable of ejaculation with consenting and non-consenting partners * Dressed well and would not stand out in upscale neighborhoods * Lived or worked near Ventura, California, in 1980 * Good physical condition * Skilled, experienced [[cat burglar]], and may have begun as such * Had a criminal record as a teenager which was [[Expungement|expunged]] * Had some means of income, but did not work in the early-morning hours * Hated women for actual (or perceived) wrongs * If married, probably had a submissive spouse who tolerated his sexually-deviant behavior * Intelligent and articulate * Probably began as a [[voyeur]] in his late teens or early twenties * Neat and well-organized in his personal life, and drove a well-maintained car * Peeped in the windows of many people who were not attacked * Possibly unmarried, and did not enter into long-term relationships * Self-assured and confident * Would continue committing violent crimes until incapacitated by prison, death, or other intervention * Would have been described by those who knew him as arrogant, domineering, manipulative, and a chronic liar
In addition to outlining the Golden State Killer's characteristics, the profile speculates that he might have been incarcerated after Janelle Cruz's murder or killed in the commission of a similar crime; however, the latter is unlikely since he contacted victims as late as 2001. Regardless, the profile recommends that law-enforcement agencies investigate attempted late-1980s [[Hot prowl burglary|hot prowl burglaries]] which resulted in the death of a lone male offender. It indicates a slight chance that the Golden State Killer committed suicide; he is unlikely to be confined in a mental institution.<ref name="PsychologicalProfile" />
According to the profile, [[teleprinter]] bulletins were broadcast to law-enforcement agencies throughout the United States after the original homicides. The bulletins requested information on similar home invasions involving sexual assault, murder, bludgeoning, multiple victims, and bondage. {{as of|2015}}, no similar crimes have been reported. The profile posits that the Golden State Killer could have continued committing his crimes in another country whose records were not linked.<ref name="PsychologicalProfile" />
== {{anchor|Correspondences}}Correspondence == === {{anchor|Letters and writings}}Letters and other writings === ==== {{anchor|"Excitement's Crave" poem (December 11, 1977)}}"Excitement's Crave" (December 11, 1977) ==== In December 1977, letters containing a poem entitled "Excitement's Crave" by an individual claiming to be the East Area Rapist were sent to the editor of the ''[[The Sacramento Bee|Sacramento Bee]]'', the Sacramento mayor's office, and the [[KVIE|KVIE TV]] station.<ref name="sudden terror" /> December 11 is the date that a masked man (probably the Golden State Killer) eluded pursuit by law-enforcement personnel after alerting authorities by telephone that he would strike on Watt Avenue that night.<ref name="Sacramento Bee no. 1">{{cite web |url = http://www.ear-ons.com/bike.html |title = In Brief: Masked Bike Rider Eludes Police |last = |first = |date = December 12, 1977 |work = The Sacramento Bee |archive-url = https://archive.today/20171031003758/http://www.ear-ons.com/bike.html |archive-date = October 31, 2017 |dead-url = yes |access-date = |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Although the authenticity of the poem has never been proven, his evasion of the police that morning may have inspired him to write it. {{quote|text=Excitement's Crave<poem> All those mortal's surviving birth / Upon facing maturity, Take inventory of their worth / To prevailing society. Choosing values becomes a task; / Oneself must seek satisfaction. The selected route will unmask / Character when plans take action. Accepting some work to perform / At fixed pay, but promise for more, Is a recognized social norm, / As is decorum, seeking lore. Achieving while others lifting / Should be cause for deserving fame. Leisure tempts excitement seeking, / What's right and expected seems tame. "Jessie James" has been seen by all, / And "Son of Sam" has an author. Others now feel temptations call. / Sacramento should make an offer. To make a movie of my life / That will pay for my planned exile. Just now I' d like to add the wife / Of a Mafia lord to my file. Your East Area Rapist And deserving pest. See you in the press or on T.V.<ref name="sudden terror" />{{rp|p. 304}}</poem>}}
==== {{anchor|The "homework pages" and the "punishment map" (December 9, 1978)}}Homework pages and punishment map (December 9, 1978) ==== [[File:EAR-ONS-"Mad is the Word" Front.jpg|thumb|alt=Manuscript in childish writing|Front of "Mad is the Word"]] [[File:EAR-ONS-"Mad is the Word" Back.jpg|thumb|alt=See caption|Reverse of "Mad is the Word"]] [[File:EAR-ONS-"Punishment" map.png|thumb|alt=Hand-drawn map|Front of the "punishment" map]] [[File:EAR-ONS-Back of "Punishment" map.png|thumb|alt=See caption|Reverse of the map, with the word "punishment" scrawled across the page]] During the investigation of the 42nd attack in Danville, investigators discovered three notebook leaves near the scene where a suspicious vehicle had reportedly been parked, although whether they originated from the East Area Rapist has not been proven.<ref name="Footsteps" /> The first leaf appears to be an essay on General [[George Armstrong Custer]].<ref name="Footsteps" /> The second contains a journal-style entry where the author writes about a teacher who made his or her students write lines, which the author found humiliating:<ref name="Footsteps" />{{quote|quote=Mad is the word, the word that reminds me of 6th grade. I hated that year{{nbsp}}... I wish I had know what was going to be going on during my 6th grade year, the last and worst year of elementary school. Mad is the word that remains in my head about my dreadful year as a 6th grader. My Madness was one that was caused by disapointments that hurt me very much. Dissapointments from my teacher, such as feild trips that were planed, then canncled. My 6th grade teacher gave me a lot of dissapointments which made me very mad and made me built a state of haterd in my heart, no one ever let me down that hard before and I never hated anyone as much as I did him. Disapointment wasn't the only reason that made me mad in my sixth grade class, another was getting in trouble at school espeically talking thats what really bugged me was writing sentances, those awful sentance that my teacher made{{nbsp}}... me write, hours and hours Id sit and write 50-100-150 sentance day and night I write those dreadful Paragraphs which embarrased me and more inportant it made me ashamed of myself which in turn, deep down in side made me realize that writing sentance wasn't fair it wasn't fair to make me suffer like that, it just wasn't fair to make me sit and wright until my bones aked, until my hand felt every horrid pain it ever had and as I wrote, I got mader and mader until I cried, I cried because I was ashamed I cried because I was discusted, I cried because I was mad, and I cried for myself, kid who kept on having to write those dane sentances. My Angryness from Sixth grade will scar my memory for life and I will be ashamed for my sixth grade year forever}}
The last is a hand-drawn map of what appears to be a suburban neighborhood, with the word "punishment" scrawled across the reverse side of the paper.<ref name="OCRegister">{{cite news |url = http://www.ocregister.com/articles/pool-525184-killer-stalker.html |title = Original Night Stalker: Could O.C. clues lead to killer? |last1 = Koerner |first1 = Claudia |date = September 10, 2013 |work = [[Orange County Register]] |access-date = March 22, 2017 |archive-url = https://archive.today/20171031003910/http://www.ocregister.com/2013/09/13/original-night-stalker-could-oc-clues-lead-to-killer/ |archive-date = October 31, 2017 |dead-url = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Investigators were unable to identify the area depicted in the map, although the artist clearly had knowledge of architectural layout and landscape design.<ref>{{Cite news |url = http://casefilepodcast.com/case-53-east-area-rapist-1978-1979-part-4/ |title = Case 53: The East Area Rapist 1978–1979 (Part 4) – Casefile: True Crime |date = June 3, 2017 |work = Casefile: True Crime Podcast |access-date = March 4, 2018 |language = en-US |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180304231838/http://casefilepodcast.com/case-53-east-area-rapist-1978-1979-part-4/ |archivedate = March 4, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> According to Detective Larry Pool, the map is a fantasy location representing the Golden State Killer's desired striking ground.<ref name="Footsteps" />
=== Phone calls === ==== "I'm the East Side Rapist" (March 18, 1977) ==== On March 18, 1977, the Sacramento County Sheriff's Office received three calls from a man claiming to be the East Area Rapist; none were recorded.<ref>{{cite web |last1 = Winters |first1 = Kat |title = Attack #15 |url = https://www.coldcase-earons.com/15.php |website = coldcase-earons.com |access-date = January 13, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180425103537/http://www.coldcase-earons.com/15.php |archivedate = April 25, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> The first two calls, received at 4:15 and 4:30 p.m., were identical and ended with the caller laughing and hanging up. The final call came in at 5:00 p.m., with the caller saying: "I'm the East Side Rapist and I have my next victim already stalked and you guys can't catch me."
==== "Never gonna catch me" (December 2, 1977) ==== A man claiming to be the rapist called the Sacramento Police, saying: "You're never gonna catch me, East Area Rapist, you dumb fuckers, I'm gonna fuck again tonight. Careful!" The call was recorded and later released.<ref name="HearTheKiller" /> Similarly to the previous call, the East Area Rapist attacked his next victim the same night.
==== "Merry Christmas" (December 9, 1977) ==== A previous victim received a phone call during the 1977 Christmas season which she attributed to her attacker. The caller said, "Merry Christmas, it's me again!"<ref name="sudden terror" />{{rp|301}}
==== "Watt Avenue" (December 10, 1977) ==== Shortly before 10:00 p.m. on the night of December 10, 1977, dispatchers from the County of Sacramento's Sheriff's Department and the City of Sacramento's Police Department received identical calls saying: "I am going to hit tonight. Watt Avenue." Both were reportedly recorded, and the caller was identified as the same person who placed the December 2 call. Law-enforcement patrols were increased that night in response,<ref name="sudden terror" /> and at 2:30 a.m. sheriff's deputies spotted a masked man bicycling on the Watt Avenue bridge; he eluded them. He was located again at 4:30 a.m. by city police. He discarded the bike, which was determined to have been stolen in [[Redding, California]],<ref name="Sacramento Bee no. 1" /> and fled on foot.
==== "Gonna kill you" (January 2, 1978) ==== The first known rape victim received a wrong-number call asking for "Ray" on January 2, 1978. The call was recorded, and police suspect that it may be the same caller who made a threatening call to her later that evening.<ref name=":5">{{Cite news |url = http://casefilepodcast.com/case-53-east-area-rapist-1976-part-1/ |title = Case 53: The East Area Rapist – 1976 (Part 1) – Casefile: True Crime |date = May 14, 2017 |work = Casefile: True Crime Podcast |access-date = March 4, 2018 |language = en-US |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180304231822/http://casefilepodcast.com/case-53-east-area-rapist-1976-part-1/ |archivedate = March 4, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> That call was also recorded and identified by the victim as the voice of her assailant.<ref name="Footsteps" /><ref name="sudden terror" /> The caller said, "Gonna kill you ... gonna kill you ... gonna kill you ... bitch ... bitch ... bitch ... bitch ... fuckin' whore."<ref name="hear">{{cite web |work = Los Angeles Magazine |url = http://www.lamag.com/thejump/hear-the-golden-state-killer/ |title = Hear the Golden State Killer |accessdate = April 28, 2018 |date = February 27, 2013 |last = McNamara |first = Michelle |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://archive.today/20171020223446/http://www.lamag.com/thejump/hear-the-golden-state-killer/ |archivedate = October 20, 2017 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
==== {{anchor|"Counseling Service" (January 6, 1978)}}Counseling service (January 6, 1978) ==== A volunteer for the Contact Counseling Service answered a call from a man claiming to be the East Area Rapist, who said: "I have a problem. I need help because I don't want to do this anymore." After a short conversation the caller said, "I believe you are [[call tracing|tracing]] this call" and hung up.<ref name="sudden terror" />{{rp|310–315}}<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.coldcase-earons.com/december77.php |title = Letters, Calls, and Sightings from December 1977 to January 1978 |access-date = May 24, 2017 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171017093818/https://www.coldcase-earons.com/december77.php |archivedate = October 17, 2017 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
==== Later calls (1982–2001) ==== In 1982, a previous victim who was working at a [[Denny's]] restaurant received a call at work from the rapist during which he said that he would rape her again. According to Contra Costa County District Attorney Paul Holes, the rapist must have gone to the restaurant and recognized one of his victims working there.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Garcia |first1=Ana |title=New details released in hunt for 'Golden State Killer' |url=https://crimewatchdaily.com/2017/12/12/new-details-released-in-hunt-for-golden-state-killer/ |accessdate=July 11, 2018 |publisher=Crime Watch Daily |date=December 12, 2017}}</ref><ref name="cwd">{{cite web |title = Pt. 2: New Clue in East Area Rapist Mystery – Crime Watch Daily with Chris Hansen |url = https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NaeIJefSAX0 |publisher = Crime Watch Daily |access-date = December 29, 2017 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180425134508/https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NaeIJefSAX0 |archivedate = April 25, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
In 1991, a previous victim received a phone call from the perpetrator and spoke with him for one minute. She could hear a woman and children in the background, leading to speculation that he had a family.<ref name="DNA" />
On April 6, 2001, the day after an article was published in the ''Sacramento Bee'' confirming that the Original Night Stalker and the East Area Rapist were the same person, a victim of the rapist received a call from him; he asked, "Remember when we played?" before hanging up.<ref name="cwd" />
== Investigation == [[File:Original night stalker - east area rapist - golden state killer - cold case - artist rendering.jpg|thumb|alt=Billboard with 1978 sketch and information|June 2016 nationwide billboard to locate the offender]] Before officially connecting the Original Night Stalker to the East Area Rapist in 2001, some law-enforcement officials (particularly from the [[Sacramento County Sheriff's Department]]) sought to link the Goleta cases as well.<ref>{{cite news |url = https://coldcase-earons.com/1980-03-13.pdf |title = Police Debate Tie Between East Area Rapist, Killings |last1 = Wilson |first1 = Wayne |date = March 13, 1980 |work = The Sacramento Bee |access-date = October 7, 2017 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171008030636/https://coldcase-earons.com/1980-03-13.pdf |archivedate = October 8, 2017 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url = https://coldcase-earons.com/1980-02-16.pdf |title = Link to East Area Rapist Probed in Couples' Slaying |last1 = Wilson |first1 = Wayne |date = February 26, 1980 |work = The Sacramento Bee |access-date = October 7, 2017 |page = B1 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20171008030325/https://coldcase-earons.com/1980-02-16.pdf |archivedate = October 8, 2017 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> The links were primarily due to similarities in ''modus operandi''. One of the already-linked Original Night Stalker double murders occurred in Ventura, {{convert|40|mi}} southeast of Goleta, and the remaining murders were committed in Orange County—an additional {{convert|90|mi}} southeast. In 2001, several rapes in Contra Costa County believed to have been committed by the East Area Rapist were linked by DNA to the Smith, Harrington, Whithuhn, and Cruz murders. A decade later, DNA evidence indicated that the Domingo–Sanchez murders were committed by the Golden State Killer.<ref name="sudden terror" /><ref>{{cite news |url = http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/05/goleta-slayings-serial-killer.html |title = 30-year-old slayings of Goleta couple linked to serial killer |last1 = Chawkins |first1 = Steve |date = May 5, 2011 |work = Los Angeles Times |access-date = October 7, 2015 |archive-url = https://archive.today/20120710223106/http://latimesblogs.latimes.com/lanow/2011/05/goleta-slayings-serial-killer.html |archive-date = July 10, 2012 |dead-url = yes |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
On June 15, 2016, the FBI released further information related to the crimes, including new composite sketches and testimony from victims and local and federal investigators.<ref name="FBIHelp" /> A press conference was held in Sacramento, where local law-enforcement agencies and the FBI announced a {{US$|50,000}} reward for information leading to the conviction of the Golden State Killer.<ref>{{Cite news |url = http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/fbi-renews-40-year-hunt-californias-most-prolific-serial-killer-by-offering-50000-reward-1565705 |title = $50,000 reward for California's 'most prolific' serial killer 30 years on |last = Piggott |first = Mark |date = June 15, 2016 |work = International Business Times UK |access-date = January 27, 2018 |language = en |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180129004327/http://www.ibtimes.co.uk/fbi-renews-40-year-hunt-californias-most-prolific-serial-killer-by-offering-50000-reward-1565705 |archivedate = January 29, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> The initiative included a national database to support law enforcement investigating the crimes and handle tips and information.<ref>{{cite web |url = https://www.fbi.gov/sacramento/press-releases/2016/fbi-announces-50-000-reward-and-national-campaign-to-identify-east-area-rapist-golden-state-killer |title = FBI Announces $50,000 Reward and National Campaign to Identify East Area Rapist/Golden State Killer |author = |date = June 15, 2016 |work = FBI |access-date = June 16, 2016 }}</ref>
== Suspects ==
During the investigation, several people were considered and eliminated as suspects: * Brett Glasby, from Goleta, was considered a suspect by Santa Barbara County investigators. He was murdered in Mexico in 1982 (before the murder of Janelle Cruz), eliminating him as a suspect.<ref>{{Cite book |title = Hunting a Psychopath |last = Shelby |first = Richard |publisher = |year = 2016 |isbn = |edition = Second |location = |pages = 392–393 }}</ref> * Paul "Cornfed" Schneider, a high-ranking member of the [[Aryan Brotherhood]]. Schneider was a career criminal, living in [[Orange County, California]], when the murders of the Harringtons, Manuela Witthuhn, and Janelle Cruz were committed. During the late 1990s, while being an inmate at [[Pelican Bay State Prison]] in [[Crescent City, California]], Schneider provided a DNA sample<ref>{{Cite news |url = http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Court-says-inmate-must-give-DNA-Suspect-in-2845640.php |title = Court says inmate must give DNA / Suspect in 20-year-old murders |last = Goodyear |first = Charlie |date = April 25, 2002 |work = San Francisco Chronicle |access-date = December 8, 2017 |archive-url = https://web.archive.org/web/20180105214004/http://www.sfgate.com/bayarea/article/Court-says-inmate-must-give-DNA-Suspect-in-2845640.php |archive-date = January 5, 2018 |dead-url = |last2 = Hallissy |first2 = Erin }}</ref> which cleared him.<ref name=":2">{{Cite news |url = https://www.coldcase-earons.com/2002-07-03.pdf |title = DNA Tests Clear Convict in Ventura Killings Paul Schneider Didn't Kill Attorney Lyman Smith, Wife |last = Cason |first = Colleen |date = July 3, 2002 |work = Ventura Star |access-date = August 29, 2017 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20170830010353/https://www.coldcase-earons.com/2002-07-03.pdf |archivedate = August 30, 2017 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> * Joe Alsip, a friend and business partner of victim Lyman Smith. Alsip had visited the Smiths' home the day before Lyman and Charlene Smith were murdered, and Alsip's pastor said that he had confessed to him during a family-counseling session. Although the reported confession was considered dubious by the Ventura County District Attorney's Office, Alsip was arraigned for the Smith murders in 1982. After the [[preliminary hearing]] the charges against him were dropped,<ref name="coldcase-earons2002">{{cite web |last1 = Cason |first1 = Colleen |title = The Silent Witness |url = http://www.coldcase-earons.com/2002-Cason-SilentWitness.pdf |publisher = Ventura County Star |accessdate = May 12, 2018 |date = November 28, 2002 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180425103545/http://www.coldcase-earons.com/2002-Cason-SilentWitness.pdf |archivedate = April 25, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite book |title = Hunting a Psychopath |last = Shelby |first = Richard |publisher = |year = 2016 |isbn = |edition = Second |location = |page = 406 }}</ref> and his innocence was confirmed by DNA testing in 1997.<ref>{{cite news |work = Ventura County Star |date = October 8, 2000 |url = http://www.coldcase-earons.com/2000-10-08.pdf |title = DNA Findings Throw New Light on Old Case By |author = Miller, Aron |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180308041636/http://www.coldcase-earons.com/2000-10-08.pdf |archivedate = March 8, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
In November 2002, journalist Colleen Cason wrote a newspaper series about the murders for the ''Ventura County Star''.<ref name="coldcase-earons2002" /> According to Cason, Detective Larry Pool of the [[Orange County Sheriff's Department (California)|Orange County Sheriff's Department]] visited California's Death Row at [[San Quentin State Prison|San Quentin]] in an attempt to locate the Golden State Killer; Pool suspected that the killer had been captured and sentenced to death for another violent crime. However, no genetic samples collected from Death Row inmates matched the DNA of the Golden State Killer.<ref name=":2" />

|access-date = April 27, 2018 |work = [[The Sacramento Bee]] |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180427183438/http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article209987599.html |archivedate = April 27, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> The website identified 10 to 20 distant relatives of the Golden State Killer (sharing the same great-great-great grandparents), from whom a team of five investigators working with genealogist Barbara Rae-Venter<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/29/science/barbara-rae-venter-gsk.html|title=She Helped Crack the Golden State Killer Case. Here’s What She’s Going to Do Next.|last=Murphy|first=Heather|date=2018-08-29|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-09-04|language=en}}</ref> constructed a large family tree. They identified two suspects in the case (one of whom was ruled out by a relative's DNA test), leaving DeAngelo the main suspect.<ref>{{cite news |last = Jouvenal |first = Justin |url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/to-find-alleged-golden-state-killer-investigators-first-found-his-great-great-great-grandparents/2018/04/30/3c865fe7-dfcc-4a0e-b6b2-0bec548d501f_story.html |title = To find alleged Golden State Killer, investigators first found his great-great-great-grandparents |date = April 30, 2018 |work = The Washington Post |accessdate = May 1, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180501161029/https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/to-find-alleged-golden-state-killer-investigators-first-found-his-great-great-great-grandparents/2018/04/30/3c865fe7-dfcc-4a0e-b6b2-0bec548d501f_story.html |archivedate = May 1, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> On April 18, a DNA sample was surreptitiously collected from the door handle of a car DeAngelo had been driving at the [[Roseville, California|Roseville]] [[Hobby Lobby]].<ref name=":13">{{Cite news|url=http://www.sacmag.com/Sacramento-Magazine/September-2018/Unsolved-Mystery/|title=Unsolved Mystery?|last=Bowker|first=Michael|date=2018-09-28|work=Sacramento Magazine|access-date=2018-10-18}}</ref> Soon after, a sample was collected from a tissue found in DeAngelo's curbside garbage can.<ref>{{cite web |title=Search warrant |url=http://www.sacda.org/files/9415/2789/1272/P_v_DeAngelo_Redacted_Search_Warrant_Final.pdf |publisher=[[Sacramento County, California]] |accessdate=June 7, 2018 |format=PDF |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180605033916/http://www.sacda.org/files/9415/2789/1272/P_v_DeAngelo_Redacted_Search_Warrant_Final.pdf |archivedate=June 5, 2018 }}</ref> Both samples were consistent with the Orange and Ventura County suspect profiles.<ref name=":62" /> After DeAngelo's arrest, some commentators raised concerns about the ethics of the secondary use of [[personally identifiable information]].<ref>{{Cite news |url = https://edition.cnn.com/2018/04/27/health/golden-state-killer-genetic-privacy/index.html |title = What the Golden State Killer case means for your genetic privacy |first = Susan |last = Scutti |work = CNN |access-date = April 28, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180429025519/https://edition.cnn.com/2018/04/27/health/golden-state-killer-genetic-privacy/index.html |archivedate = April 29, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url = https://www.wired.com/story/detectives-cracked-the-golden-state-killer-case-using-genetics/ |title = The Creepy Genetics Behind the Golden State Killer Case |last = Molteni |first = Megan |date = May 27, 2018 |work = WIRED |access-date = April 28, 2018 |language = en-US |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180427214045/https://www.wired.com/story/detectives-cracked-the-golden-state-killer-case-using-genetics/ |archivedate = April 27, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref>
DeAngelo was born on November 8, 1945 in [[Bath, New York]], to Joseph James DeAngelo Sr. and Kathleen Louise DeGroat, and he has two sisters: Rebecca and Connie and one brother: John. When he was 9–10 years old he saw Connie get raped.<ref>{{Cite web | url=https://nypost.com/2018/05/14/golden-state-killer-witnessed-men-rape-his-sister-report/ | title=Family of 'Golden State Killer' claim he saw men rape his 7-year-old sister| date=2018-05-14}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |last1 = McBride |first1 = Jessica |title = Joseph James DeAngelo's Mother & Father: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know |url = https://heavy.com/news/2018/04/joseph-deangelo-mother-father-kathleen-bosanko/ |accessdate = April 28, 2018 |publisher = [[Heavy.com]] |date = April 27, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180427215438/https://heavy.com/news/2018/04/joseph-deangelo-mother-father-kathleen-bosanko/ |archivedate = April 27, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> He attended ninth grade at Mills Middle School in Rancho Cordova, California.<ref>{{cite news |last1 = Egel |first1 = Benjy |title = Here's what the East Area Rapist suspect looked like as a Rancho Cordova 9th-grader |url = http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article210161414.html |accessdate = May 1, 2018 |publisher = [[The Sacramento Bee]] |date = April 30, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180502043841/http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article210161414.html |archivedate = May 2, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |publisher = Mills Middle School |year = 1961 |title = Graduates |url = http://www.e-yearbook.com/sp/eybb?school=1030842&year=1961&up=2&startpage=31 |accessdate = May 1, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180502064627/http://www.e-yearbook.com/sp/eybb?school=1030842&year=1961&up=2&startpage=31 |archivedate = May 2, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> He graduated from [[Folsom High School]] in June 1964.<ref name="SacBee Folsom High">{{cite news |last = Egel |first = Benjy |url = http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article209823959.html |title = Who is the East Area Rapist? Police say it's this ex-cop who attended Folsom High |date = April 25, 2018 |accessdate = May 7, 2018 |newspaper = Sacramento Bee |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180428010913/http://www.sacbee.com/news/local/crime/article209823959.html |archivedate = April 28, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> DeAngelo joined the U.S. Navy in September that year,<ref name=":8">{{Citation|title=Ep. 16 Sgt. Joe DeAngelo, Exeter PD {{!}} 12-26-75|url=https://shows.pippa.io/5b0b51d35d2f788725c01ea7/ep-16-sgt-joe-deangelo-exeterpd|accessdate=June 8, 2018}}</ref> and served for 22-months during the [[Vietnam War]] as a [[damage controlman]] on the [[cruiser]] [[USS Canberra (CA-70)|USS ''Canberra'']],<ref>{{cite news |url = https://www.newspapers.com/clip/19560455/joseph_j_deangelo_expected_home_on/ |title = Joseph J. DeAngelo expected home on leave from Navy soon |work = Auburn Journal |date = June 1, 1967 |access-date = April 26, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180427023759/https://www.newspapers.com/clip/19560455/joseph_j_deangelo_expected_home_on/ |archivedate = April 27, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> and received [[National Defense Service Medal|National Defense Service]], [[Vietnam Service Medal|Vietnam Service]] and [[Vietnam Campaign Medal]]s.
From August 1968, DeAngelo attended [[Sierra College]], graduating with an associate degree in police science with honors in June 1970. He was [[engagement|engaged]] to Bonnie Colwell in May 1970; they were classmates at Sierra College, but they never married. Colwell purportedly called off the marriage. Investigators believe this might be connected to the offender reportedly saying, "I hate you, Bonnie!" during at least one of the attacks.<ref name=":6">{{Cite news |url = https://www.mercurynews.com/2018/04/26/i-hate-you-bonnie-golden-state-killer-likely-motivated-by-animosity-toward-ex-fiancee-investigator-says/ |title = 'I hate you, Bonnie': Golden State Killer likely motivated by animosity toward ex-fiancee, investigator says |last = Sulek |first = Julia |date = April 26, 2018 |work = The Mercury News |access-date = May 8, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180508131500/https://www.mercurynews.com/2018/04/26/i-hate-you-bonnie-golden-state-killer-likely-motivated-by-animosity-toward-ex-fiancee-investigator-says/ |archivedate = May 8, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=":11">{{Citation|last=KTVU|title=Full Interview: Golden State Killer investigator Paul Holes|date=2018-05-02|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tP1gni1gGvk|access-date=2018-08-13}}</ref>
In 1971, he attended [[California State University, Sacramento|Sacramento State University]], where he focused on criminal law and received a bachelor's degree in criminal justice.<ref name="SacBee Folsom High" /><ref name=":8" /> He then went on to do post-graduate work,<ref name=":8" /> before undergoing training (Kings County Public Safety Academy) at the [[College of the Sequoias]] in Visalia,<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.sacda.org/files/9415/2789/1272/P_v__Final.pdf|title=DeAngelo Redacted Search Warrant - page 127|last=|first=|date=|website=|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=June 30, 2018}}</ref> and completing a 32-week police internship at [[Roseville, California|Roseville]] Police Department.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.thesungazette.com/wp-content/uploads/2018/04/Deangelo_Article_ExeterSun_22Aug1973-1.png|title=Navy veteran serves Exeter as policeman|last=|first=|date=August 22, 1973|website=The Sun-Gazette Newspaper|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=June 8, 2018}}</ref><ref name=":9">{{Cite web|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/EARONS/comments/8etq80/more_information_on_le_connection/|title=r/EARONS - More information on LE connection!|last=The Exeter Sun|date=May 23, 1973|website=reddit|language=en|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=June 8, 2018}}</ref>
He was then a police officer in [[Exeter, California|Exeter]] (a town of about 10,000 people near Visalia,<ref name=":13" /> having relocated from [[Citrus Heights]]<ref name=":9" />) from May 18, 1973 to August 1976. He married Sharon Marie Huddle on November 19, 1973. Huddle went to college in Fresno, California. Afterwards, she attended law school in Sacramento, California. She became an attorney in December 1982.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://members.calbar.ca.gov/fal/Member/Detail/105101|title=Sharon M Huddle #105101 - Attorney Search|first=The State Bar of|last=California|date=|website=members.calbar.ca.gov|accessdate=August 13, 2018}}</ref> They had three daughters and separated in 1991.<ref name=":6" />
By 1976 he had been promoted to sergeant and was in charge of the Exeter Police Department's "Joint Attack on Burglary" program.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.reddit.com/r/EARONS/comments/8fmapg/jjd_heads_the_burglary_task_force_in_exeter/|title=Anti-Burglary Funds Okayed|last=Visalia Times-Delta|date=May 11, 1976|website=www.reddit.com|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=}}</ref> He then served in [[Auburn, California|Auburn]] (part of [[Sacramento metropolitan area|Greater Sacramento]]) from August 1976 to July 1979, when he was caught [[shoplifting]] a hammer and dog repellent<ref name="What We Know">{{cite news |url = https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/26/us/joseph-james-deangelo.html |title = What We Know About Joseph DeAngelo, the Golden State Killer Suspect |last = Haag |first = Matthew |work = The News York Times |date = April 26, 2018 |access-date = April 29, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180429120126/https://www.nytimes.com/2018/04/26/us/joseph-james-deangelo.html |archivedate = April 29, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref><ref name=":11" /> and was sentenced to six months [[probation]] in October that year.
His employment history for the next decade is unknown.<ref name=":11" /> From 1990 until his retirement in 2017, DeAngelo was a truck mechanic at the Roseville distribution center for [[Save Mart Supermarkets]].<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.sacbee.com/latest-news/article209862599.html |title = Here's where East Area Rapist suspect worked for nearly three decades before retiring |last = Lillis |first = Ryan |work = The Sacramento Bee |date = April 25, 2018 |accessdate = April 26, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180426061346/http://www.sacbee.com/latest-news/article209862599.html |archivedate = April 26, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> DeAngelo was living in Citrus Heights with a daughter and granddaughter at the time of his arrest.<ref name=":11" /> His [[in-law|brother-in-law]], James Huddle, said that DeAngelo casually brought up the East Area Rapist in conversation around the time of the original crimes.<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.oxygen.com/joseph-james-deangelo-golden-state-killer-relative-rapes |title = Joseph James DeAngelo, Golden State Killer Suspect, Once Asked Relative About Serial Rapes |last = Silverstein |first = Jason |website = Oxygen.com |date = April 25, 2018 |access-date = April 26, 2018 |deadurl = no |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20180426023130/http://www.oxygen.com/joseph-james-deangelo-golden-state-killer-relative-rapes |archivedate = April 26, 2018 |df = mdy-all }}</ref> Neighbors reported that DeAngelo frequently engaged in loud, [[profanity|profane]] outbursts.<ref name="What We Know" />
=== Legal proceedings === DeAngelo cannot be charged with rapes due to the statue of limitations expiring for those offenses, but he has been charged with 13 counts of murder and also is being charged with 13 counts of kidnapping. DeAngelo returned to court on July 12, 2018. Appearing again before Judge Michael Sweet, DeAngelo was shackled inside the courtroom holding area throughout the duration of the proceedings. Later, on August 13, 2018, Tulare County Sheriff's Office held a press conference to announce that they will be charging DeAngelo for the September 11, 1975 murder of Claude Snelling in Visalia.
On August 21, 2018 at 11:00 AM, a coalition of district attorneys appeared together to issue statements to the press. Presenting together were Contra Costa County DA, Diana Becton, Orange County DA, Tony Rackauckas, Sacramento County DA, Anne Marie Schubert, Santa Barbara County DA, Joyce E. Dudley, Tulare County DA, Tim Ward, Ventura County DA, Gregory D. Totten, and Lisa Bartlett, Supervisor of the 5th District (where the Orange County murders took place). This group of officials is in charge of prosecuting the case against DeAngelo, the alleged Golden State Killer. He was arraigned in Sacramento on August 23, 2018. Several DAs involved in the case were present in the courtroom, and members of the public were allowed to attend. In the gallery were several survivors, family members, and witnesses who will be participating in the upcoming series of preliminary hearings, many of whom gave interviews to the media at the conclusion of court business.<ref>{{Cite web | url=https://goldenstatekillertrial.com | title=Golden State Killer Trial – the Trial of Joseph DeAngelo}}</ref>

{{primary sources|date=August 2011}} {{Infobox recurring event | name = Great Forest Park Balloon Race | image = GFPBR071082.JPG | imagesize = frameless | dates = September 16–18 | frequency = Annual | location = [[Forest Park (St. Louis, Missouri)|Forest Park]], [[St. Louis, Missouri|St. Louis]], [[Missouri]] | years_active = {{age|1973|09|10}} | participants = 70 | attendance = 130,000 | genre = [[Hot air balloon festival]] | website = http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com }} The '''Great Forest Park Balloon Race''' is an annual [[hot air balloon festival]] held in [[Forest Park (St. Louis, Missouri)|Forest Park]] in [[St. Louis, Missouri]]. With more than 70 entrants and 130,000 spectators, it is the most well-attended single-day hot air balloon race in the United States.<ref name="racehist">[http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com/history.htm Great Forest Park Balloon Race: History].</ref>
==History== The first race was launched by Nikki Caplan and John O'Toole in December 1973 at a gathering of six balloons and twenty spectators.<ref name="loc">[http://lcweb2.loc.gov/diglib/legacies/MO/200003213.html Library of Congress: Balloon Race].</ref> In 1977, organization of the race passed from Caplan and O'Toole to a group of four novice balloonists who continue to coordinate the event today. These men are John Marlow, John Schaumburg, Ted Staley, and Dan Schettler, who formed a ballooning group known as the Mississippi River Balloon Transit Company. This company now is the host of the largest and most well attended balloon race.<ref name="racehist"/><ref>{{cite web|last=Mississippi River Balloon Transit|title=Great Forest Park Balloon Race|url=http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com/|accessdate=2011-09-28}}</ref> On May 23, 2000, the race was honored by the American Folklife Center at the [[Library of Congress]] as a local legacy after a nomination by then-[[Minority leader of the United States House of Representatives]] [[Dick Gephardt]].<ref name="racehist"/><ref name="loc"/> So now, the Great Forest Park Balloon Race is forever documented through photographs, advertisements, media, and pilot rewards.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mississippi River Balloon Transit Company|title=History of the Race|url=http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com/history.htm|accessdate=2011-09-29}}</ref>
==Current status== [[File:St. Louis Forest Park Ballon Glow -Sep 05.jpg|thumb|Balloon Glow in September 2005]] On the day before the race, the [[hot air balloons]] participate in the Balloon Glow, a [[night glow]] opportunity for spectators to walk among inflated balloons illuminated by their burners.<ref name="racesched">[http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com/schedule.htm Great Forest Park Balloon Race: Schedule].{{verify credibility|date=August 2011}}</ref> In addition to the Balloon Glow and a [[fireworks]] show, during the week of the event, a free public orchestral concert by the [[Saint Louis Symphony Orchestra]] is held on nearby Art Hill, adjacent to the [[Saint Louis Art Museum]]. During the race, the balloonists attempt to "chase" a 166-foot balloon of a pink bunny after taking off from the Central Fields in Forest Park.<ref name="slfp">{{cite web|url=http://www.slfp.com/ETC-BalloonRace.htm|publisher=St. Louis Front Page|date=September 19, 2009|title=Great Forest Park Balloon Race - Energizer Bunny Birthday Celebration Takes the Cake|last=Moore|first=Betty|accessdate=July 29, 2011}}</ref> The goal is to follow the bunny until it lands, and then each pilot drops a sandbag or birdseed bag as close as possible to the bunny balloon. The winner is decided based on which pilots's sandbag, or birdseed bag, is the closest to the bunny.<ref>{{cite web|last=Mississippi RIver Balloon Transit Company|title=Race Schedule|url=http://www.greatforestparkballoonrace.com/schedule.htm|accessdate=2011-09-29}}</ref> Due to its urban location in the city of St. Louis, the race is considered "particularly prestigious and challenging", and participation is by invitation only. At times, landing sites have included backyards, baseball diamonds, golf courses, street intersections, and the convent grounds of the [[School Sisters of Notre Dame]].<ref name="loc"/> The balloon race is accompanied by a festival that includes food and drink, [[inflatable castle]]s, and a [[climbing wall]].<ref name="slfp"/>
